de.fuberlin.panda.metadata.result.fusion.clustering

Class ClusterDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fuberlin.panda.metadata.result.fusion.clustering.ClusterDetector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArealClusterDetector, TemporalClusterDetector

    public abstract class ClusterDetector
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is basically an implementation of the OPTICS-OF algorithm developed by Mihael Ankerst, Markus M. Breunig, Hans-Peter Kriegel and JÃ¶rg Sander. It detects clusters in a set of data by augmented ordering the entries and assign them to clusters regarding their outliner factors.

    For a closer look on the OPTICS algorithm check the paper "OPTICS: Ordering Points To Identify the Clustering Structure". For more information about OPTICS OF check the paper "OPTICS-OF: Identifying Local Outliers". You can find both papers by a simple google search.
    Since:
    27.01.2014
    Author:
    Sebastian Schulz
    See Also:
    ClusterDetector(double, int), detectClusters(TreeSet), createClusterOrdering(TreeSet), createClusterResult(), isInClusterRange(ClusteringObject), #calculateReachabilities(TreeSet, ClusteringObject), #updateSeedQueue(TreeSet, ClusteringObject), calculateNeighborhood(ClusteringObject, TreeSet)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClusterDetector

        public ClusterDetector(double neighborhoodRadius,
               int minNeighbors)
        Public Constructor, which sets the neighborhood radius and the minimal neighbors which should be in the radius to detect a cluster.
        Parameters:
        neighborhoodRadius - - a double value which represents the radius around an clustering object where minNeighbors other objects has to be to detect a cluster.
        minNeighbors - - a int value which represents the minimal count of neighbors which has to be in the neighborhoddRadius to mark a group of objects as n cluster.

      • ClusterDetector

        public ClusterDetector(double neighborhoodRadius,
               int minNeighbors,
               double maxOutlierFactor)
        Public Constructor, which sets the neighborhood radius, the minimal neighbors and the maximum outlier factor which are used to detect the clusters.
        Parameters:
        neighborhoodRadius - - a double value which represents the radius around an clustering object where minNeighbors other objects has to be to detect a cluster.
        minNeighbors - - a int value which represents the minimal count of neighbors which has to be in the neighborhoddRadius to mark a group of objects as n cluster.
        maxOutlierFactor - - a double value which represents the maximum outlier factor for which an object still belongs to a cluster.

    • Method Detail

      • detectClusters

        public ClusteringResult detectClusters(java.util.TreeSet<? extends ClusteringObject> clusteringObjects)
        This method is called to perform the clustering in accord with the OPTICS OF algorithm. It calls createClusterOrdering(TreeSet) to generate a augmented cluster-ordering of a given Set of ClusteringObjects. With calling createClusterResult() the ordering is iterated to obtain the clusters and return them in a ClusteringResult object.
        Parameters:
        clusteringObjects - - a TreeSet of ClusteringObjects which should be analyzed.
        Returns:
        ClusteringResult - a ClusteringResult object which holds the outlier indices as well as lists of indices of cluster members.

      • createClusterOrdering

        private void createClusterOrdering(java.util.TreeSet<? extends ClusteringObject> clusteringObjects)
        This method is responsible for ordering the given TreeSet of ClusteringObjects in an augmented form. The ordering is archieved in three steps:
        1. calculate the infinite neighborhood and the core distance for each entry with calculateCoreDistances(TreeSet)
        2. calculate the reachabilities and generate an ordering this basis with calculateReachabilities(TreeSet)
        3. calculate the augmentation with getting the outlier factors of each entry with #calculateOutlierFactors()
        Parameters:
        clusteringObjects - - a TreeSet of ClusteringObjects which should be analyzed.

      • calculateCoreDistances

        protected void calculateCoreDistances(java.util.TreeSet<? extends ClusteringObject> clusteringObjects)
        This method calculates the infinite neighborhood and sets the infinite core distance of each clusteringObject. The infinite neighborhood is defined as either all neighbors which are in the neighborhoodRadius range (if the clusteringObject is a real core object) or minNeighbors objects (if the clusteringObject has less then minNeighbors objects in the range of neighborhoodRadius.
        Parameters:
        clusteringObjects - - a TreeSet of ClusteringObjects which should be analyzed.

      • calculateReachabilities

        protected void calculateReachabilities(java.util.TreeSet<? extends ClusteringObject> clusteringObjects)
        This method does most of the work of the OPTICS OF algorithm. It creates the augmented clustering order of a given TreeSet of ClusteringObjects. It iterates over every clusteringObject which wasn't processed yet. First the reachability distance is set to UNDEFINED because the given clusteringObject wasn't reachable from other objects (else it would be processed from the orderedSeedQueue). Afterwards it is added to the resultClusterList.

        Because the current object has at least minNeighbors neighbors the updateSeedQueue(ClusteringObject) method is called to insert or update the reachability distance of all neighbors.

        Now all neighbors are processed the same way and the orderedSeedQueue is updated if necessary.
        Parameters:
        clusteringObjects - - a TreeSet of ClusteringObjects which should be analyzed.
        clusteringObject - - the current ClusteringObject.

      • updateSeedQueue

        private void updateSeedQueue(ClusteringObject centerObject)
        This method is responsible for updating the orderedSeedQueue. A loop iterates over all unprocessed neighbors of the given ClusteringObject and checks if the reachability distance from the current neighbor to the clusteringObject can be minimized. The call of the updateReachabilityDistance(ClusteringObject, double) handles the update of the reachability distance and the placement in the orderedSeedQueue.

        If the current neighbor is one of the minNeighbors neighbors the reachability distance from the centerObject to the neighbor is added up to the neighborsReachabilitySum which is needed for calculating the local reachability denisity of the centerObject. This value is set by calling ClusteringObject#setLocalReachabilityDensity(double, int) after all neighbors are processed.
        Notice that the reachability distance in this case is the max{core distance of neighbor, distance of centerObject to neighbor}!
        Parameters:
        neighbors - - a Set of ClusteringObjects which represent the neighbors of the given ClusteringObject.
        clusteringObject - - the current processed ClusteringObject.

      • updateReachabilityDistance

        private void updateReachabilityDistance(ClusteringObject neighbor,
                              double newReachabilityDistance)
        This method updates the reachability distance of a given ClusteringObject called neighbor. If the neighbor hasn't had a reachability distance the new calculated distance is added as reachability distance and the neighbor is added to the orderedSeedQueue. Otherwise the reachability distance is updated in case the new reachability distance is smaller than the existing and the neighbor is moved in the orderedSeedQueue.
        Parameters:
        neighbor - - a ClusteringObject, the current neighbor the reachability distance should be updated for.
        newReachabilityDistance - - a double value which represents the new reachability distance.

      • calculateOutlierFactors

        protected void calculateOutlierFactors(java.util.TreeSet<? extends ClusteringObject> clusteringObjects)
        This method iterates over the given TreeSet of ClusteringObjects and calls the ClusteringObject.setOutlierFactor(int) for every entry to calculate the outlier factors.
        Parameters:
        clusteringObjects - - a TreeSet of ClusteringObjects which should be analyzed.

      • createClusterResult

        private ClusteringResult createClusterResult()
        This method creates a new ClusteringResult object and adds the metadata indices of the objects from the augmentedClusteringObjectList to the clustering result.
        Returns:
        ClusteringResult - a ClusteringResult object which holds the outlier indices as well as lists of indices of cluster members.

      • isInClusterRange

        private boolean isInClusterRange(ClusteringObject clusteringObject)
        This method simply checks whether the given ClusteringObject is in a cluster range with other objects or not. There are three cases:
        1. Reachability distance is undefined, this means a "jump" to another cluster or to an outlier.
        2. Outlier factor is greater than the boundary value (maxOutlierFactor), this also means a "jump" to an outlier. 3. Outlier factor is smaller than the boundary, object is still in the same cluster.
        Parameters:
        clusteringObject - - the current ClusteringObject.
        Returns:
        a boolean value which represents if the given ClusteringObject is in a cluster range with other objects.

      • calculateNeighborhood

        protected abstract void calculateNeighborhood(ClusteringObject clusteringObject,
                         java.util.TreeSet<? extends ClusteringObject> clusteringObjects)
        This abstract method has to be implemented by every sub class. It determines the neighborhood of a given ClusteringObject regarding the neighborhoodRadius and the minNeighbors.
        Parameters:
        clusteringObject - - the current ClusteringObject, which is in the center of the neighborhoodRadius.
        clusteringObjects - - a Set of ClusteringObjects which should be analyzed.
